verses.kjv: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan by Jericho.
verses.web: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.ct: The people of Israel traveled on and set up camp on the plains of Moab, across the Jordan River from Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.web: Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.ct: Balak son of Zippor saw everything Israel had done to the Amorites.

verses.kjv: And Moab was sore afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.
verses.web: Moab was very afraid of the people, because they were many. Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Moab was terrified of the Israelites because there were so many of them. The whole nation was filled with dread.

verses.kjv: And Moab said unto the elders of Midian, Now shall this company lick up all that are round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of the field. And Balak the son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at that time.
verses.web: Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this multitude will lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field.” Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.
verses.ct: Moab said to the elders of Midian, "This horde is going to devour everything around us the way an ox devours grass in a field." At that time, Balak son of Zippor was king of Moab.

verses.kjv: He sent messengers therefore unto Balaam the son of Beor to Pethor, which is by the river of the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt: behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abide over against me:
verses.web: He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, “Behold, there is a people who came out of Egypt. Behold, they cover the surface of the earth, and they are staying opposite me.
verses.ct: He sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor, which is by the Euphrates River in the land of his people. The message said: "A people has come out of Egypt. They've spread across the land and have settled right next to me.

verses.kjv: Come now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me: peradventure I shall prevail, that we may smite them, and that I may drive them out of the land: for I wot that he whom thou blessest is blessed, and he whom thou cursest is cursed.
verses.web: Please come now therefore, and curse this people for me; for they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I shall prevail, that we may strike them, and that I may drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
verses.ct: Please come and put a curse on these people for me — they're too powerful for me to fight. Maybe then I'll be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land. I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed."

verses.kjv: And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand; and they came unto Balaam, and spake unto him the words of Balak.
verses.web: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand. They came to Balaam, and spoke to him the words of Balak.
verses.ct: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian set out, carrying payment for divination. They arrived at Balaam's home and delivered Balak's message.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as the LORD shall speak unto me: and the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
verses.web: He said to them, “Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as LORD shall speak to me.” The princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
verses.ct: Balaam told them, "Stay here tonight, and I'll give you an answer based on what the LORD tells me." So the officials from Moab stayed the night with Balaam.

verses.kjv: And God came unto Balaam, and said, What men are these with thee?
verses.web: God came to Balaam, and said, “Who are these men with you?”
verses.ct: God came to Balaam and asked, "Who are these men with you?"

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto God, Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, hath sent unto me, saying,
verses.web: Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has said to me,
verses.ct: Balaam answered God, "Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:

verses.kjv: Behold, there is a people come out of Egypt, which covereth the face of the earth: come now, curse me them; peradventure I shall be able to overcome them, and drive them out.
verses.web: ‘Behold, the people that has come out of Egypt covers the surface of the earth. Now, come curse me them. Perhaps I shall be able to fight against them, and shall drive them out.’ ”
verses.ct: 'A people has come out of Egypt and spread across the whole land. Come and curse them for me. Maybe then I'll be able to fight them and drive them out.'"

verses.kjv: And God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them; thou shalt not curse the people: for they are blessed.
verses.web: God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
verses.ct: God told Balaam, "Do not go with them. You must not curse these people, because they are blessed."

verses.kjv: And Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Get you into your land: for the LORD refuseth to give me leave to go with you.
verses.web: Balaam rose up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your land; for LORD refuses to permit me to go with you.”
verses.ct: Balaam got up the next morning and told Balak's officials, "Go back to your own land. The LORD won't let me go with you."

verses.kjv: And the princes of Moab rose up, and they went unto Balak, and said, Balaam refuseth to come with us.
verses.web: The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak, and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
verses.ct: So the officials from Moab returned to Balak and reported, "Balaam refused to come with us."

verses.kjv: And Balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honourable than they.
verses.web: Balak again sent princes, more, and more honorable than they.
verses.ct: Balak responded by sending another delegation — more officials, and more distinguished ones than the first group.

verses.kjv: And they came to Balaam, and said to him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor, Let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from coming unto me:
verses.web: They came to Balaam, and said to him, “Balak the son of Zippor says, ‘Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me,
verses.ct: They came to Balaam and said, "This is what Balak son of Zippor says: 'Please, don't let anything stop you from coming to me.

verses.kjv: For I will promote thee unto very great honour, and I will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.
verses.web: for I will promote you to very great honor, and whatever you say to me I will do. Please come therefore, and curse this people for me.’ ”
verses.ct: I'll reward you with great honor and do whatever you ask. Just come and curse these people for me.'"

verses.kjv: And Balaam answered and said unto the servants of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the LORD my God, to do less or more.
verses.web: Balaam answered the servants of Balak, “If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can’t go beyond the word of LORD my God, to do less or more.
verses.ct: Balaam replied to Balak's servants, "Even if Balak gave me his entire palace filled with silver and gold, I couldn't go against the command of the LORD my God in any way, large or small.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray you, tarry ye also here this night, that I may know what the LORD will say unto me more.
verses.web: Now therefore please stay here tonight as well, that I may know what else LORD will speak to me.”
verses.ct: But please, stay here tonight as well, so I can find out if the LORD has anything more to say to me."

verses.kjv: And God came unto Balaam at night, and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up, and go with them; but yet the word which I shall say unto thee, that shalt thou do.
verses.web: God came to Balaam at night, and said to him, “If the men have come to call you, rise up, go with them; but only the word which I speak to you, that you shall do.”
verses.ct: That night God came to Balaam and said, "Since these men have come to summon you, go ahead and go with them. But you must do only what I tell you to do."

verses.kjv: And Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his ass, and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.web: Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.ct: So Balaam got up the next morning, saddled his donkey, and left with the officials from Moab.

verses.kjv: And God’s anger was kindled because he went: and the angel of the LORD stood in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding upon his ass, and his two servants were with him.
verses.web: God’s anger burned because he went; and LORD’s angel placed himself in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
verses.ct: But God's anger burned because Balaam went. The angel of the LORD positioned himself in the road to block Balaam's path. Balaam was riding his donkey, and his 2 servants were with him.

verses.kjv: And the ass saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and the ass turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam smote the ass, to turn her into the way.
verses.web: The donkey saw LORD’s angel standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and the donkey turned out of the path, and went into the field. Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the path.
verses.ct: The donkey saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand. She veered off the road and into a field. Balaam hit the donkey to force her back onto the road.

verses.kjv: But the angel of the LORD stood in a path of the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.
verses.web: Then LORD’s angel stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.
verses.ct: Then the angel of the LORD stood in a narrow path between 2 vineyards, with stone walls on both sides.

verses.kjv: And when the ass saw the angel of the LORD, she thrust herself unto the wall, and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall: and he smote her again.
verses.web: The donkey saw LORD’s angel, and she thrust herself to the wall, and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall. He struck her again.
verses.ct: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD, she pressed against the wall, crushing Balaam's foot against it. So he hit her again.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD went further, and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
verses.web: LORD’s angel went further, and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD moved ahead once more and stood in a spot so narrow there was no room to turn right or left.

verses.kjv: And when the ass saw the angel of the LORD, she fell down under Balaam: and Balaam’s anger was kindled, and he smote the ass with a staff.
verses.web: The donkey saw LORD’s angel, and she lay down under Balaam. Balaam’s anger burned, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verses.ct: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD, she simply lay down under Balaam. Furious, Balaam beat her with his staff.

verses.kjv: And the LORD opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these three times?
verses.web: LORD opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
verses.ct: Then the LORD gave the donkey the ability to speak. She said to Balaam, "What have I done to you that you've hit me 3 times?"

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would I kill thee.
verses.web: Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have mocked me, I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now I would have killed you.”
verses.ct: Balaam snapped at the donkey, "You've made a fool of me! If I had a sword right now, I'd kill you!"

verses.kjv: And the ass said unto Balaam, Am not I thine ass, upon which thou hast ridden ever since I was thine unto this day? was I ever wont to do so unto thee? And he said, Nay.
verses.web: The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long until today? Was I ever in the habit of doing so to you?” He said, “No.”
verses.ct: The donkey replied, "Am I not the same donkey you've ridden your whole life? Have I ever done anything like this before?" "No," he admitted.

verses.kjv: Then the LORD opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and he bowed down his head, and fell flat on his face.
verses.web: Then LORD opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw LORD’s angel standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed his head, and fell on his face.
verses.ct: Then the LORD opened Balaam's eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with a drawn sword. Balaam immediately bowed low and fell facedown on the ground.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because thy way is perverse before me:
verses.web: LORD’s angel said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out as an adversary, because your way is perverse before me.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD said to him, "Why did you beat your donkey 3 times? I came here to oppose you because the path you're on is reckless and wrong.

verses.kjv: And the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.
verses.web: The donkey saw me, and turned away before me these three times. Unless she had turned away from me, surely now I would have killed you, and saved her alive.”
verses.ct: Your donkey saw me and turned away from me all 3 times. If she hadn't turned away, I would have killed you by now — and spared her life."

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto the angel of the LORD, I have sinned; for I knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if it displease thee, I will get me back again.
verses.web: Balaam said to LORD’s angel, “I have sinned; for I didn’t know that you stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases you, I will go back again.”
verses.ct: Balaam said to the angel of the LORD, "I have sinned. I didn't realize you were standing in the road to stop me. If this journey displeases you, I'll turn back."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto Balaam, Go with the men: but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.web: LORD’s angel said to Balaam, “Go with the men; but only the word that I shall speak to you, that you shall speak.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD told Balaam, "Go with the men, but speak only the words I give you." So Balaam continued on with Balak's officials.

verses.kjv: And when Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which is in the border of Arnon, which is in the utmost coast.
verses.web: When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him to the City of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, which is in the utmost part of the border.
verses.ct: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at a Moabite city on the border of the Arnon River, at the far edge of his territory.

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour?
verses.web: Balak said to Balaam, “Didn’t I earnestly send for you to summon you? Why didn’t you come to me? Am I not able indeed to promote you to honor?”
verses.ct: Balak said to Balaam, "Didn't I send for you urgently? Why didn't you come the first time? Don't you think I can reward you properly?"

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Lo, I am come unto thee: have I now any power at all to say any thing? the word that God putteth in my mouth, that shall I speak.
verses.web: Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come to you. Have I now any power at all to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that shall I speak.”
verses.ct: Balaam answered Balak, "Well, I'm here now. But I have no power to say whatever I want. I can only speak the words God puts in my mouth."

verses.kjv: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto Kirjathhuzoth.
verses.web: Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth.
verses.ct: Balaam went with Balak, and they traveled to Kiriath Huzoth.

verses.kjv: And Balak offered oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes that were with him.
verses.web: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him.
verses.ct: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent portions to Balaam and the officials who were with him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal, that thence he might see the utmost part of the people.
verses.web: In the morning, Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal; and he saw from there part of the people.
verses.ct: The next morning, Balak took Balaam up to the high places of Baal, where he could look out and see part of the Israelite camp below.
